intro: Teline pallida subsp. gomerae, commonly known as the Gomera bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or limestone soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pale blue or white in color. It is adapted to the arid and coastal environments of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
